author: Special Correspondent
text:
Folklore must be translated and transformed into modern poetry, said Sirpi Balasubramaniam, former Head of the Department of Tamil, Bharathiar University and Sahitya Akademi awardee.

Epics such as ‘Silapathigaaram’ and Ramayanam have taken their core concept from folklore, he said at the inaugural of a seminar on ‘multi dimensional view on folklore’ organised by Periyar University here recently.

Folklore is an umbrella term which includes stories, poems, riddles and poems of villages, he said adding that the present generation should pay interest to rewrite the ancient stories and poems with modern content.

C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor, Periyar University, inaugurated the seminar. He highlighted the importance to record our ancient customs, practices entrenched in the literature and tradition. T. Periasamy, Professor and Head, Department of Tamil of the university, offered felicitations.
title: ‘Rewrite ancient stories with modern content’
